decks.notes: The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells that can deal damage quickly. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to control the board and put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes support cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand to help with card draw and finding the right cards at the right time. With a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent can mount a defense.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and removal, countering opponent's threats while maintaining control of the game. Cards like Negate, Deadly Cover-Up, and Shoot the Sheriff help to control the board, while Jace, the Perfected Mind and Stock Up provide card advantage. Oildeep Gearhulk and Doomsday Excruciator are strong finishers, with Tishana's Tidebinder providing additional control. The deck utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw to outvalue opponents and establish dominance on the battlefield. Additionally, the mana base is carefully planned to ensure smooth casting of spells.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to achieve a powerful game-winning play. The deck includes cards that help search for key components, disrupt opponents' plans, and set up the conditions for a big finish. The Omniscience Combo allows the player to cast spells without paying their mana cost, providing a significant advantage. By carefully managing resources and timing, the player can unleash a devastating series of spells and overwhelm their opponent in a single turn.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful instant and sorcery spells. The goal is to deal as much damage as possible in the early game to put pressure on the opponent and finish them off quickly. The deck includes a mix of cheap creatures with haste, burn spells, and card draw to maintain tempo and keep the pressure on. By utilizing efficient spells and creatures, the player aims to control the board and secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan while efficiently attacking and dealing damage. By utilizing a combination of removal spells like Go for the Throat, counter spells like Phantom Interference, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck aims to stay a step ahead of the opponent and maintain pressure on their life total. With a strong aggressive game plan backed up by disruptive elements, the deck aims to secure victory through a mix of tempo and attrition.

This Esper Aggro deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggression. The deck includes a mix of creatures with abilities that enhance each other, along with instant and sorcery spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the color requirements of the deck, ensuring that the spells can be cast efficiently. By combining speed, synergy, and disruption, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to establish their own strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Manifold Mouse, along with efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Monstrous Rage and Witchstalker Frenzy provide additional ways to increase damage output and push for a quick victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells in a Rakdos color strategy. It includes a mix of big creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Etali, Primal Conqueror, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Torch the Tower. The deck also has reanimation potential with cards like Zombify to bring back powerful creatures. Overall, the focus is on quick and efficient aggression to dominate the opponent.
